Together these products process the following data:    Identification data;     Contact details;     Products and services usage information, including metadata about entry of any data into these products, metadata about sending, receiving and viewing messages and files, searches made and keywords used etc.;     any other data that are entered into, uploaded into or generated by these products, including content of any e-mails, messages, calendars, tasks, contact details, shared files etc.       Desktop applications     Desktop applications (Desktop Client, TeamChat Desktop, Outlook Sync, Desktop Office apps) synchronize e-mails, calendars, contacts, tasks, notes, chat content and files with IceWarp. These products process the following data:     Identification data;     Contact details;     Products and services usage information, including metadata about entry of any data into these products, metadata about sending, receiving and viewing messages and files, searches made and keywords used etc.;     any other data that are entered into, uploaded into or generated by these products, including content of any e-mails, messages, calendars, tasks, contact details, shared files etc.       Mobile applications     Mobile applications process the same scope of data as their desktop counterparts, with a few specifics:    Products and services usage information may include metadata about the mobile device, phone number, IMEI, application diagnostics data, crash data and other telemetry data if you choose to provide feedback on your usage of the app;     Products and services usage information may include metadata about authorizations and logins into applications (Authenticator app);     Products and services usage information may include location data (IceChat app).     any other data that are entered into, uploaded into or generated by these apps may include content stored on the device such as photos and files (IceChat app, IceWarp app).     Processing of data in our cloud micro - services  We also offer single-purpose cloud services called micro-services, which are hosted on infrastructure provided by IceWarp. Micro-services are available both to cloud and on-premise customers.  In relation to the data processed on our infrastructure, we only process your personal data to perform contract about provision of products to your organization, where we act as a processor to your organization in line with concluded data processing agreement (applies to cloud customers and to on-premise customers using Recordings and Dashboard).  In relation to the use of micro-services (other than Recordings and Dashboard) by on-premise customers, no data processing takes place as these micro-services act as a runtime environment only. All data remains stored on the server of your organization or devices provided by your organization.  We offer the following micro-services:    Conferences     Our Conferences micro-service allows for secure video conferencing that runs in the browser, without installing anything on the user devices. Features like screensharing, real-time chat or password protection of meetings are included. This micro-service processes the following data:    Identification data;     Contact details;     Products and services usage information, including metadata about entry of any data into this micro-service, metadata about any conferences held, metadata about sending, receiving and viewing messages etc.;     any other data that are entered into, uploaded into or generated by this micro-service, including content of any conference calls, messages, shared files, shared screens etc.       Recordings     Recordings micro-service allows for recording of any video conference held and storing it on our cloud. Any person making these recordings is responsible for further processing of these recordings, including the obligation to inform and obtain consent of meeting attendees with the fact that the conference session will be recorded, stored and/or disseminated.  If your organization (user of our on-premise products or cloud services) selects to use Recordings micro-service and store them in the cloud, it becomes a party to data processing agreement of the storage provider for Recordings micro-service listed in Section F.    Documents     Our Documents micro-service allows creation, modification and sharing of documents, spreadsheets and presentations in the browser. Documents micro-service also enables collaboration of users within organization in real-time. This micro-service processes the following data:    Identification data;     Contact details;     Products and services usage information, including metadata about entry of any data into this micro-service, metadata about any documents created and their modifications, metadata about cooperation on documents and sharing these documents;     any other data that are entered into, uploaded into or generated by this micro-service, including content of any documents, including any comments and reviews etc.       Antivirus     Our Antivirus micro-service provides multi-vendor document and attachment security by comparing anonymous file signatures with a global database of previously scanned file signatures which is stored in the cloud. Unknown files are securely uploaded to the service, scanned and deleted. This micro-service processes the following data:    Identification data;     Contact details;     Products and services usage information, including metadata about entry of any data into this micro-service, metadata about any documents uploaded and scanned, metadata about detection of malicious code in the documents;     any other data that are entered into, uploaded into or generated by this micro-service, including content of any documents.       Preview     The Preview micro-service offloads the processing of file/media/document previews from your server into the cloud. This allows to present a glanceable version of the document before the user opens it. Supported files are securely uploaded to the service, transformed into a thumbnail and deleted. This micro-service processes the following data:     Identification data;     Contact details;     Products and services usage information, including metadata about entry of any data into this micro-service, metadata about any files uploaded, metadata about the format of the original document and the resulting thumbnail;     any other data that are entered into, uploaded into or generated by this micro-service, including content of any documents.       Shortener     The Shortener service makes sharing files easier by providing a short version of a file's web address. The service stores original URL, the resulting short URL and each time the short link is accessed, it records the time and IP address used to access it, providing the user with file open statistics as well as geographical location of the file's recipient. This micro-service processes the following data:    Identification data;     Contact details;     IP Adress(es) used to access the short link;     Identification of devices used to access the short link;     Products and services usage information, including metadata about usage of this micro-service, metadata about any links shortened, metadata about the linked files;       Dashboard     The Dashboard centralizes the most vital information for the user on a dedicated interactive panel. The micro-service stores and displays the user's Dashboard settings, background image and notes data. This micro-service processes the following data:    Identification data;     Contact details;     Notes;     Pinnned items (files, teamchat threads, recordings and so on);     Products and services usage information, including metadata about entry of any data into this micro-service, metadata about any pinned items, metadata about the user settings of the interface;     any other data that are entered into, uploaded into or generated by this micro-service, including content of any documents.     Processing of data  when providing   professional  services  When we provide our services, we in some cases need to process your personal data on behalf of your organization.   In cases where we process data as a part of the service, i.e. in case of Migration service, where we process all the data that are migrated to or from our products, we act as a processor to your organization in line with concluded data processing agreement.  In other cases, we have generally no access to data and do not process data as a part of the service, but provision of the service may result in an ad-hoc or incidental access to data. In these cases, we act as a person with access to personal data under the authority of the controller, i.e. your organization. This applies in case of our remaining services, i.e. Deployment, Upgrades, Trainings, Consulting, Health Check, Support (including SLA Subscription), Managed Services, Monitoring, Custom Development and Custom Services.    Changes to this Privacy Policy     This Privacy Policy is current as of January 2, 2023. We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time, so please be sure to check back periodically. We will post any changes to this Privacy Policy on our website. These changes will be effective immediately for new users and will become effective for existing users through continued use of the products/services after the effective date of the posted change. If we make any changes to this Privacy Policy that materially affect our practices with regard to the personal information we have previously collected from you, we will endeavor to provide you with an advance notice of such change by highlighting the change on our website. If you do not approve the changes to our use of your personal information, you should notify us to deactivate your account with us and erase your data.    Contact our Data Processing Officer     If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or Our Data Processing Agreement or any of our activaties related to your personal information, please contact our Data Protection Officer at dpo@icewarp.com. You may also write to us at the following address:  IceWarp Limited  Attn: IceWarp Data Protection Officer  P.O.Box 50184  3601 Limassol  Cyprus
